attributes.action: Increase UC by £20/week for disabled claimants with limited capability to work.
attributes.background: Increase UC by £20/week for people who meet the “limited capability to work” & “limited capability for work and work related activity”. People who meet these criteria are recognised by the Government as not being able to work due to disability and will not benefit from the taper rate changes.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government has removed the £20 uplift for Universal Credit that was put in place during the Covid-19 pandemic. This £20/week made a huge difference to people, helping to top up rent where UC does not pay the whole amount or helping pay for food and energy.

The autumn budget has decreased the taper rate for UC claimants and increased the work allowance so people who work are slightly better off but disabled claimants who are not well enough to work are left at a disadvantage.

departments.name: Department for Work and Pensions

attributes.action: Create a law that requires unnecessary lighting to be turned off
attributes.background: Create a law that requires lights in shop window displays to be turned off at 1am. Interior lights in offices and other non-residential buildings should be switched off an hour after the last employee leaves.
attributes.additional_details: The impact will be to save wasted energy and reduce the impact of light pollution in the country, all of which damages wildlife, humans and the environment.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Ban the burning of peat for fuel
attributes.background: The government should ban the use of peat as fuel. Instead, the government should support the development of sustainable energy sources. Peatlands should be protected from harvesting for any reason, not just for horticulture.
attributes.additional_details: The recent announcement to ban peat in horticulture is a positive step for protecting peatlands. But a significant proportion of peat is harvested for use as fuel to burn. This still results in peatlands being destroyed and increases carbon emissions.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Require labels on all products showing water and carbon usage in manufacture
attributes.background: Just as we have nutritional information, alcohol volume and energy consumption ratings on product - we ask that manufacturers add a label to indicate how much water and carbon went into the manufacture of a product in the form of a clear and easy to understand rating for consumers.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Provide funding to colleges & apprenticeships for eco-community house building
attributes.background: COVID19 has catastrophic effects for the UK. Apprentices in trades such as construction have been sacked before completing their training. FE Colleges will lose vital funding and staff, damaging the educational system for generations.
attributes.additional_details:
Skills training must continue online using new ideas, methods. But to highest energy A standard and open to all.

For UK's  shattered economy to bounce back, we must harness our wartime spirit and ingenuity. While academic subjects can be assessed for qualifications, trades cannot. We had a skills gap before, we face a chasm now. With the collapse of hospitality, retail, theatres etc we have a pool of potentially millions of recruits, unemployed and needing jobs We need to build 300,000 homes, to zero carbon standards, no compromise. Build fast: Build well,  Build Eco, Build a greener Britain!

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Lower the standard rate of income tax due to cost of living increases
attributes.background: With the extortionate prices of travel, petrol, energy bills and more on the rise, I believe the standard rate of income tax should be lowered from 20% to 15%-18%. A lot of lives have changed during the pandemic, particularly those in low income households, struggling to afford everyday necessities.
attributes.additional_details: The increased prices are causing a setback in everyone’s financial situations. One case being the “generation rent to generation buy”, many of whom cannot afford to get onto the property ladder. Monthly rents are extortionate and mortgages even harder to obtain. The cost of travel increasing will encourage more workers to stay at home. However, the rise in energy bills means the cost of working at home is also higher.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Subsidise electricity costs for Electric Vehicle owners and EV charging points
attributes.background:
As consumers we are advised to go green and have a green agenda to get us there. But the increasing energy costs are a barrier to this.
 
I urge the Government to come up with a mechanism to subsidise electricity costs for Electric Vehicle owners and Public EV charging point operators.
attributes.additional_details: With the electricity Bill's raising nearly 54% in April 2022, subsidised energy costs would help encourage more people to switch to Electronic Vehicles, and help get us closer to achieving our green agenda targets.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Create a ten-year interest free loan for domestic green energy transition
attributes.background: The Government should create funding in the form of an interest-free loan repayable over (up to) ten years for people to spend on solar, heat pump or insulation projects as appropriate to their domestic situation (including community energy proposals).
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the current energy sector model is creating misery for millions and wrecking any hope of a decent future for future generations. Alternatives exist now to help tackle many of our problems regarding the climate, cost of living and long-term energy security.

This is a critical moment to incentivise people to transition. In the same time it will take to get new nuclear up and running we could reduce peoples' energy costs, massively boost UK-based industry and get a lot closer to meeting our net zero targets.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Reduce the electricity Green Levy for home Heat Pump owners to the same as gas
attributes.background:
Make heat pump ownership less expensive as a matter of urgency in order to encourage uptake and achieve zero-carbon earlier.

The electricity for them costs 4 times more than gas running an equivalent gas boiler. Heat pumps may be 3 times more efficient but, for many, the numbers don’t stack up.
attributes.additional_details:
Plans to gradually equalise the green levies on gas and electricity have been shelved because of the energy crisis. Yet at the same time, Government seeks to encourage the uptake of heat pumps. Unfortunately, their running costs are a big disincentive for many and those costs are artificially increased by the x 10 difference between the ‘green tax’ treatment of gas and electricity even though electricity is greener.

Please stop penalising those who want to do the right thing by the planet!

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: UK Government: restrict reduced VAT on domestic energy to renewable sources only
attributes.background: Apply the reduced VAT rate on energy consumption - currently 5% - only where supplies of that energy derive from a renewable source.
attributes.additional_details: To demonstrate that the UK is serious about reaching net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Remove the 2 child limit for Universal Credit and Child Tax Credit
attributes.background: Today we are faced with the harshest cost of living crisis in years. Energy bills have increased dramatically while inflation is 10.1%.
attributes.additional_details:
In light this I am proposing the UK Government show a little more compassion and help families who have 3 or more children by abolishing the two child limit.

I believe all families deserve to be able to keep their heads above water. Families with 2 children get help for each of those 2 children to feed them and pay the bills so why should families that are larger be treated differently?

Why should larger families be discriminated against or be in a worse position than those with 2 or less children? Why should those children not have full tummies or not be cold in the winter? It's just discrimination not to abolish it.

departments.name: Department for Work and Pensions

attributes.action: Ban the importation of wood pellets used for the generation of electricity.
attributes.background: Importation of wood pellets should be banned and the use in power stations should be urgently reviewed. Burning of wood pellets must not be considered sustainable or a means of meeting net zero targets. Billions of UK green subsidies into this technology must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Using wood pellets releases more CO2 than burning coal. Because the government considers wood pellets as a renewable resource, by re-planting trees, the emissions are classed as carbon neutral and “helps” to get closer to the neutral target in 2030. This is not the case. Deforestation is happening around the world to supply the UK with wood pellets for burning, which generates around 11% of our energy needs. British taxpayers are funding this destruction of forests.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Allow members of the public to ask questions at PMQ's in Parliament
attributes.background: It should be fair, that when the Prime Minister goes into PMQ's (Prime Ministers Questions) a group of members of the public should be allowed to ask questions to the Prime Minister, either in the benches or over a video line/link.
attributes.additional_details:
Yes, our elected officials are informed about our problems such as the cost of living crisis (including fuel and energy costs), spending on public services, and other concerns for our country. However, officials and even the PM do not see the direct impact of their decisions on the public.

Having members of the public actively taking part in the PMQ's could actually show the members of parliament see what their "changes" and "rules" and doing to the British Public.

departments.name: Office of the Leader of the House of Commons

attributes.action: Subsidise household energy costs, during Stay at Home restrictions
attributes.background: Arrange to cover increased energy costs to households incurred following Government guidelines and policies to stay at home during pandemic.
attributes.additional_details:
People are being asked to:
 tay at home to save lives, Work from home, remote classrooms from home.
Staying at home equals increased energy costs.

How are households, staying at home, too stay safe, healthy, and warm without extra income or reduced energy bills to cover the extra costs?

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Add green infrastructure as a nationally significant project to the Planning Act
attributes.background: The Planning Act is heavily focused on infrastructure, such as road, rail and energy. We need legislation that enables conservation bodies (Environment Agency, Natural England) to apply for planning consent, including compulsory acquisition, for green infrastructure for the good of the nation.
attributes.additional_details: Green infrastructure is a planned network of natural and semi-natural spaces with other environmental features designed to deliver a range of ecosystem services. The Government should do this to promote importance of the UK environment and conservation in its national planning. At present, the legislation is centred around mitigation, when there should be a greater promotion of new green infrastructure. It should be up to the planning authority to determine whether there is a 'Case for the Scheme' in the interest to the public. Currently there is no mechanism for green infrastructure schemes to come forward and be assessed.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Ensure registered electricians can pull DNO fuses for work
attributes.background: The Government should review existing prerequisites, both legislative and imposed by distributors, for removing DNO refuses, and implement reforms to ensure registered electricians can pull DNO fuses for work.
attributes.additional_details: Currently electricians often face significant delays and costs contacting energy providers and distributors to enable them to pull the DNO fuse. We can rewire buildings of any size but there are inconsistent processes for pulling DNO fuses. It seems daft and the delay in getting it sorted can take weeks during which time a client could be in danger from outdated electrics.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: National minimum wage to £15 to help working families as inflation rises
attributes.background: Due to the inflation rate and fuel prices families are struggling with living costs and to beat the inflation rate and it should be raised to £15 to help stay ahead of rising costs.
attributes.additional_details: Because the energy prices and fuel prices are at a all time high and with the inflation potentially reaching over 18% the Government seriously need to look at the minimum wage properly. We believe to keep ahead of the inflation people would need £15 an hour to survive.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Exempt Government Ministers from the £400 energy bill discount
attributes.background: Exempt serving Government Ministers in the Cabinet (on the day of the Chancellors announcement of the £400 energy bill discount) from receiving the £400 energy bill discount.
attributes.additional_details: To show Government Ministers how difficult the cost of living increases are for the general public by foregoing income they expected to receive.

attributes.action: Increase UK green energy investment in geothermal sources
attributes.background: For every kilometre drilled into earth, the temperature increases by 25-30 degrees Celsius. The deeper the holes the hotter and more constant the temperature. This can power both heating systems and electrical energy production 100% of the time.
attributes.additional_details: Green energy is our future. Recently gas supply scares mean we are not 100% energy capable. Geothermal energy is 24/7. Not depending on sun or wind. Installed can run for 100 years almost maintenance free and not require much pumps capacity. In COP26 the UK could commit 'cross party' to this being the focus of investment creating jobs and the global expertise on this industry. These don't leave us with unsightly installations (solar/wind) 1 system every 60km sq. in the UK would power all homes.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Adopt British Double Summer Time, and British Standard Time in winter
attributes.background:
This will help ordinary working people reduce their energy bills as it provides for longer useable daylight hours in the evening.

Historically British Double Summer Time has been implemented when there has been a need to conserve energy such as during WW2 and in 1973.
attributes.additional_details:
People are struggling with their energy bills.

By implementing this change to time we will have more natural light in the evenings and this will help to reduce energy costs as well as afford more opportunity for exercise and improvement in mental health.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make VAT zero for all Battery Systems used with Renewable Energy generation
attributes.background: Addition of a battery to a renewable energy system allows optimum use of on-site renewable energy, thereby reducing demand on the National Grid.
attributes.additional_details:
We want VAT zero on battery systems used with renewable energy generation, for home or business use, regardless of when this is installed.

Renewable energy promotion is part of UK Government strategy.

Many homes and small businesses have on-site renewable electricity generation, such as Solar Photovoltaic or Wind turbine.

At the time of writing, if a property owner orders a renewable energy system with simultaneous installation of a battery, this is NOT liable to VAT. Retrospective addition of a battery is currently liable to VAT.
For many system owners, the battery option may not have been available at time of install. The current difference in tax liability is unjust.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Ban the sale of energy drinks to under 18s
attributes.background: I would like the government to make it illegal for shops to sell energy drinks to people under the age of 18.
attributes.additional_details: We know that energy drinks are not healthy for young people, and I have seen the effect it has had on young people in my area.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Remove VAT on loft insulation
attributes.background: The average semi detached house needs 16 rolls of insulation material 200 mm thick, to bring any existing 70 mm insulation up to current building standards. The 20% VAT on 16 rolls of insulation typically exceeds £200. This petition calls for the removal of all VAT from insulation materials.
attributes.additional_details: At a time of inflated energy costs and the threats caused by climate change. Householders need help and encouragement to take affordable steps to reduce the burden on the nation's energy needs. To add 20% to the cost of home insulation is unhelpful, discouraging and nonsensical.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of energy drinks to under 16s
attributes.background: There is currently no law regarding the sale of energy drinks to children. This needs to be changed as soon as possible, so that energy drinks cannot be sold to under 16s.
attributes.additional_details: Energy drinks are high in caffeine and often other chemicals that children should not be ingesting in large amounts. Consuming these drinks can have an adverse impact on children's physical and mental health. There needs to be an immediate ban on the sale of energy drinks to under 16s.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Enable Ofgem to set a Variable Price cap based on Usage and Council Tax Band
attributes.background: Consider the benefits of giving Ofgem powers to set a Variable Price cap on energy tariffs, based on a 'volume pricing' model, with different rates depending on a household's council tax band.
attributes.additional_details:
For example:
 
Those living in council tax band F, could be charged 5p per kWh per month for the first 500 kwh, increasing to 7p per kWh per month, for the next 250 kwh, increasing to 9p per kWh per month for the next 250 kwh..... etc
 
Those living in council tax band H, could be charged 9p per kWh per month for the first 500 kwh, increasing to 12p per kWh per month, for the next 250 kwh, increasing to 15p per kWh per month for the next 250 kwh..... etc
 
This method of pricing would reward those who use less energy, encouraging people to reduce consumption, and it allows those whose assets indicate they may be able to afford more, to subsidise those whose assets indicate they may struggle.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Increase support for energy bills for households with disabled children
attributes.background: With soaring energy costs many parents of disabled children are struggling to afford the energy  bills for their necessary life-saving equipment.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition aims to persuade the Government to increase support for energy bills to cover those costs.
 
This Government needs to make adequate provision for the most vulnerable who, through no fault of their own, are struggling.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Invest in new nuclear and renewable generation to replace fossil fuels
attributes.background: This petition calls for investment in a hybrid system of renewable energy (solar panels and wind turbines) with nuclear power plants, to be built on a national scale. This will combine the advantages of both to help make a real difference to the climate crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
40°C is not a normal temperature for the UK, yet it happened this July. If we don't act now, climate change will only get worse.

An effective way to tackle this it is to transform the way we produce electricity. Scientific advancements have made it possible to phase out non-renewables: renewable energy is cheaper (than non-renewables) and easy to build on a large scale but are less reliable. As nuclear plants are both safe and reliable, a hybrid system of both should help cut down greenhouse emissions.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Require solar panels on all building by 2030
attributes.background: The Government need to make it law that all businesses, public bodies and residents install solar panels on any properties they own, by 2030 to help reduce carbon foot print and reduce wholesale cost of solar panels and energy
attributes.additional_details:
The Government has made a major breakthrough to stop the sale of new petrol and diesel cars, to reduce our carbon footprint.
 
Now we want this to go further by passing law to to force all everyone to install solar panels on all properties by 2030, to help reduce carbon foot print and reduce wholesale cost of solar panels and energy for all the people of Britain.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Reduce the price cap of gas and electricity during the UK Lockdown
attributes.background:
Throughout the UK Lockdown due to the coronavirus outbreak, because the public have been told to stay at home the cost of energy/ energy pricing should be reduced massively. 

No one/ no companies should be profiting from the misery of the public through this crisis.
attributes.additional_details: The government should look at this petition to reduce and cap pricing so that the public are not left in energy debt and further in crisis.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Commit to cutting school carbon footprints to zero by 2025
attributes.background: The Government should pledge to cut schools' carbon footprints to zero. This could be achieved through the installation of air source heat pumps, solar panels on roofs, energy efficient lighting, better insulation and other energy efficiency measures.
attributes.additional_details: Achieving this would make schools a shining example and beacons for environmental change. Not only would the energy efficiencies count towards our UK carbon reduction targets but the message sent out to all pupils and students in schools would be that of positive change, and would surely spread throughout society. There are just under 25,000 schools in England. A Government pledge to drive schools towards carbon neutrality would be an investment fit for everyone's futures.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Introduce a 30% 'Middle rate' of income tax for those earning £50,271 - £80,000.
attributes.background: Inflation is peaking and taxes are also increasing. It is becoming difficult for many middle-income families to survive with current earnings. With the 1.25% increase in NI tax from April 2022, it will be more difficult for people to save any money. Income tax should be reformed to reflect this.
attributes.additional_details:
Increasing energy and gas bills have increased the burden on everyone, and income tax should be reformed to reduce the financial burden on people earning over £50,000.
 
There is no tax rate of 30% on annual income. There should be a new tax rate introduced for people earning £50,271 to £80,000, replacing the current start of the higher income tax band, to at least ease out the burden of the people.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Run a public awareness campaign to reduce energy and resource consumption
attributes.background: I want the Government to run a national public awareness campaign encouraging people to reduce energy and resource consumption. This should call on people to:
attributes.additional_details:
*Turn the tap off when brushing teeth
*Stop eating fish to help save the environment
*Turn power off when phones charged
 
Because as one person I lack the power and resources to reach every home and every person with this message before it's too late, but the Government can.
 
The Government needs to act on behalf of the world and be its voice, and encourage all citizens to act responsibly.
 
The Government has the power to make the world a better place for the future of mankind, but also the power to make it worse. How you choose to act now will determine which one of those it is!

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Enable the Government to access Bank of England GRANTS to fund Public Services!
attributes.background:
The current methods of funding Public Services through taxation, borrowing & profits from the Public Sector limit the UK Government’s ability to improve Public Services and Living Standards

If the UK Government didn't have limited finance available to it, it could be capable of greater investment
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government should be able to fund spending on Public Services from the Bank of England to Improve Living Standards.

The Government could use this funding to increase Minimum Wage, Pensions, Improve Public Services like the NHS and protect our Planet better.

Government can also help finance Scientific & Medical Research much better. Financial Incentives and Support can be given by Government to Industries to go Carbon Neutral & Energy Providers to produce Clean & Renewable Energy.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Prevent increases to bills including council tax and NHS charges this year
attributes.background: The Government should pass legislation preventing the costs of council tax, energy charges, prescriptions, dentists and vehicle tax being increased this year.
attributes.additional_details:
Many key workers & average working classes cannot afford all of these increases. Many people are not getting grants or payouts, especially the self-employed.
 
We cannot afford to get into even more debt. Show some solidarity especially for the working class and key workers

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Require businesses turn off all non emergency lights during hours of closure
attributes.background: On approach to winter amidst an energy crisis, we should be looking for ways to save electricity no matter how small. Shops and businesses waste tons of electricity every night by leaving their lights on in stores. This must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Introduce emergency legislation to require that shops and other business must turn off all non emergency lighting during hours of closure when staff have left.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Set a target for 100% renewable energy by 2022
attributes.background: The Government needs to set a target for 100% renewable energy target by 2022. The Government had decades to support a move to renewable energy and they can do this if they got up and worked to tackle the current climate crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to act extremely quick and hard against this climate crisis. This is the biggest crisis we have ever faced. It’s sad to see politicians doing the bare minimum to fight against the crisis; they don’t care enough and turn a blind eye to this crisis.
 
We all have been seeing these effects for decades now. It can only get worse from now if we don’t take action NOW. NOW is when the action needs to start, not tomorrow, not next week, not next month, not next year, NOW.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban energy-wasting open fridges and freezers in all retail outlets
attributes.background: Retailers in the United Kingdom unnecessarily waste huge amounts of energy on open fridges and freezers. Climate change threatens our planet. If all supermarkets had doors on their fridges and freezers it could save energy the equivalent of the entire residential population of Poland

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Move start of BST forward to the last Sunday in February
attributes.background: Move the start of BST to the last Sunday in February, to achieve parity closer to the dawn and dusk times of the autumn clock change. This would give the UK one month longer in British Summer Time (BST) and one month shorter GMT (Greenwich Mean Time).
attributes.additional_details:
1, This could save co2 emissions as lighter evenings should mean less energy used on home and street lighting.
2, Lighter evenings can give better safety to people traveling by whatever means.
3, Lighter evenings can encourage people to exercise more.
4, It could boost public spirit.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Suspend VAT on pet food and pet care for 12 months, and reduce to 5% thereafter
attributes.background: Suspend VAT on pet foods and basic pet care (eg. vet consultations, vaccinations, flea and worm treatments) for a period of 12 months and subsequently reduce it to 5% permanently.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the current economic climate where many people will struggle to pay their bills, feeding and caring for pets is another worry pet owners will have. It may be pets could be handed in to already overstretched charities or even dumped if owners cannot afford to feed and care for their pets.

This could be devastating, particularly for older people who rely on their pets for company.

It would also help charities who facing higher energy costs as well as having to look after more animals.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Replace nuclear power with hybrid-solar-battery power in the energy strategy
attributes.background: We the undersigned, want the government to replace monolithic, stagnating nuclear power in the energy strategy with roof-based, modular, sustainable, rapidly evolving hybrid-solar-battery systems and insulation for all social-housing. Batteries will supply baseload power when the sun doesn’t shine.
attributes.additional_details: Installing hybrid-solar-battery systems and insulation for about 4 million social-houses could immediately add an ever-increasing capacity each year, taking less than 5 years to reach full capacity. The power costs less than £44/MWh and could provide over 16 TW baseload per year which could replace about half of current Russian gas energy imports. It could create about 50 thousand long-term service jobs and take-up no extra land. It produces zero pollution from free UK sunlight and, year-on-year, drives down unit costs to grow our green industries and generate more tax revenue. The government could reduce benefits in line with about 50% energy savings in social-housing households to recoup the capital investment in as little as 6 years.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make it illegal for energy providers to charge more per unit for pre-paid energy
attributes.background: Energy providers often charge higher rates per unit to customers on pre-payments energy meters. This is unacceptable as it is normally people who are on low incomes who are not permitted to change to a credit meter. Essentially these are additional costs placed upon those who can least afford them.
attributes.additional_details: Ensure that pre payment customers are treated fairly and that the per unit charge is no more than the equivalent unit charge for a credit meter customer.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: To save energy, require shops to keep their doors closed during opening hours.
attributes.background: Introduce legislation requiring all shops to have their doors closed (that is, not fixed open) during opening hours. This proposal is prompted by both the current high cost of energy, and wasting precious energy and the costs of producing it on a planet that is experiencing global warming.
attributes.additional_details: We all understand that shops need to be welcoming to customers, but customers should quickly realise that a closed door does not mean a closed shop. Many shops appear to put fear of missing out on potential customers above the desire to conserve energy - whether heating or air conditioning, No shop should feel disadvantaged if all shops were required by law to have their doors closed so as reduce energy waste.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Abolish the bedroom tax
attributes.background: With the cost of living and rising prices I’m asking that the bedroom tax be abolished to help us Vulnerable . Disabled and the Elderly who have to pay this out when it would help us in this crisis. As it would be spare money to help towards our cost of heating our homes this winter.
attributes.additional_details: With abolishing the bedroom tax it would ease a bit of pressure from us as we are struggling to make ends meet. Being on benefits don’t cover all living costs from eating to energy crisis and rising prices.  I would like this to be looked at something that can be done.  As more pressure is put on us as the energy price cap isn’t for the 2 years as promised and prices set to rise again in April.  In a modern world we shouldn’t have to live like this. So please consider this request

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Provide energy grants for the hospitality sector
attributes.background: We would like the Government to issue energy grants to business in the hospitality sector, many of which have seen their energy bills double over the last year.
attributes.additional_details: In line with struggling families, we want the Government to support hospitality businesses that are facing spiralling fuel bills, to help prevent more pubs and restaurants avoid bankruptcy.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Invest in hydrogen fuelling stations AND hydrogen fuel cell car manufacturers
attributes.background: Government need to invest in creating more fuelling stations with hydrogen capabilities as well as invest in UK based car manufacturers to create more HFC vehicles. Reducing the number fossil fuel powered cars on the road will reduce our CO² emissions to help the UK meet our climate targets.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change is a crisis, one that can and should have been averted by now. Inaction on this matter is going to cause global devastation of crops, record breaking droughts year on year which will eventually lead to mass migrations of refugees. To have a chance to prevent this, we need to switch to greener energy solutions, one of which being Hydrogen Fuel Cell vehicles which have been thoroughly safety tested.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Provide grants for energy costs for people who are shielding
attributes.background: We who are vulnerable have to shield, and in the winter this means we are using more gas and electric, but many people who are shielding cannot afford these additional costs, and are having to go without heating. This can lead to the deterioration of health of people who are already vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should provide grants for energy costs for people who are shielding, to ensure that they are able to pay for heating in the winter.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Government to assist households with winter energy bills during Covid Pandemic
attributes.background: We would like the government to pay towards the winter energy bills (Gas, Electric, Water) of households who will have a greater increase of use due to staying home and working from home because of the Covid Pandemic. Much like the American ‘Stimulus cheques’ but paid direct to energy providers.
attributes.additional_details: Households will have already noticed an increase in their energy bills over the last few months due to staying home and working from home because of Covid. We would like the government to offer assistance to all households responsible for gas, electric and water payments by paying a reasonable sum of money towards each bill paid directly to their provider. This in order to reduce the number of people falling behind on their payments due to the increased usage they will experience.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Set a 5-year plan to lead the UK to self-sustainability, less reliance on others
attributes.background:
Create new targets to be achieved over a 5 year span of time, to lead the UK to increase its self suitability, and rely less on imports from other nations. In terms of agriculture, energy, medicines etc.
Also work to increase the science and engineering sectors of this nation.
attributes.additional_details: Brexit has lead us to see that without a deal we will struggle, with increasing prices, and so by increasing our own suitability, we would be able to tackle many issues. By promoting our science and engineering sectors we could become far more sustainable as well as increase our own exports to back up the economy.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy
Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Provide funding for installation of solar PV on social housing
attributes.background: The Government should provide new funding for local authorities to install solar PV on social housing. This, alongside other measures announced, should help alleviate fuel poverty on the poorest people at risk from the energy crisis.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the most vulnerable people live in social housing, and are affected by fuel poverty. The Government should provide funds for the installation of solar PV on social housing. This could be targeted to prioritise those on benefits. Tenant would benefit from energy generated and be able to do things like a washing at virtually no cost. Any surplus could be fed back to the grid, with the relevant local authority being paid for this by energy companies.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Subsidise energy and fuel prices to mitigate cost increases
attributes.background: We want the Government to subsidise the cost of energy and fuel so this costs no more for consumers than 50% over 2020 prices. The cost of this should be recouped by medium-term cost increases, and contributions from energy companies.
attributes.additional_details:
The country is in crisis. Radical action is needed to avert a major crisis that could culminate in social unrest or even riots.
 
By taking this action now the Government can help reduce inflation by tackling one of the sources of inflation. Rising energy and fuel costs create inflation that can spiral out of control because businesses have to increase prices to stay in business. Avert this by absorbing the increase. This could also help avert an economic crisis caused by inflation.
